meanings.definition: Customs or habits that have been established and followed for a long time.
meanings.sent1: The consuetudes of our family include gathering for dinner every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: In many cultures, consuetudes dictate how weddings are celebrated.
meanings.sent3: The consuetudes of the penguins involved a daily march around the icy terrain.
meanings.sent4: The consuetudes of the forest whispered ancient tales to those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The village's consuetudes painted a vivid picture of unity and tradition.

meanings.definition: Traditional practices or behaviors that are commonly observed within a particular group or society.
meanings.sent1: The consuetudes of the tribe included a dance to celebrate the harvest.
meanings.sent2: Learning the consuetudes of a new workplace can be challenging at first.
meanings.sent3: The consuetudes of the bees amazed the young onlookers with their teamwork.
meanings.sent4: The consuetudes of the city streets hummed with the rhythm of daily life.
meanings.sent5: The school's consuetudes shaped the students' daily routines and interactions.
